alert.note: Alert for Howard (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 31 at 12:51AM CDT until May 31 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN HOWARD...SOUTHWESTERN WINONA...NORTHWESTERN HOUSTON AND FILLMORE COUNTIES... At 1251 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fountain to near Harmony, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Lanesboro around 1255 AM CDT. Canton around 100 AM CDT. Rushford around 110 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Choice, Wyattville, Isinours, Hutton, Riceford, Peterson and Rushford Village. This includes Interstate 90 in Minnesota between mile markers 244 and 255. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
